mysterions documentation¶

Add your content using reStructuredText syntax. See the reStructuredText documentation for details.

mysterions.py

A demo game for the final assignment for the University of Helsinki MOOC Center (https://www.mooc.fi/en/) online course Python Programming MOOC 2025 (https://programming-25.mooc.fi/).

https://programming-25.mooc.fi/part-14/4-your-own-game

The game requirements include:

  • The game has a sprite the player can move in some way

  • The game has some collectable items and/or enemies

  • The player needs to be set a clear task in the game

  • The game contains a counter which tells the player how they are doing in the game

  • The source code for the game is divided into functions like in the Sokoban example (https://github.com/moocfi/sokoban)

class mysterions.Button(text: str, x: int = 0, y: int = 0, width: int = 100, height: int = 50, color: set[int, int, int] = (80, 80, 80))¶

LRUD_KEYS = {'down': 1073741905, 'left': 1073741904, 'right': 1073741903, 'up': 1073741906}¶

The keys for moving the robot.

MONSTER_CHARGE_DIRECT_THRESHOLD = 40¶

When using the Charge maneuver, the distance in pixels from the robot the monster can be before it can go diagnolly. (Otherwise it can only go LRUD)

MONSTER_CLEAR_THRESHOLD = 50¶

The amount of space needed to be around a monster to be considered free of obstacles and it can begin Charging toward the robot (Charge maneuver)

MONSTER_RANDOM_TURN_PACES_RANDRANGE = (100, 250)¶

When peforming the Random Turn on the Knight Move maneuver, the range of paces (distance in pixels) the monster can go after the turn. (Basically minimum and maximum distance.)

MONSTER_RANDRANGE = (5, 15)¶

The number of monsters that can be randomly added to the board.

MONSTER_VELOCITY = 1.0¶

The speed of the monsters (pixels per refresh)

MONSTER_WOBBLE_RNG = 1000¶

Adjusts the wobble factor of the monsters Lower value = more wobbly Min value = 200

MOVING_OVERLAP_FACTOR = 20¶

Used by is_overlap, the amount of pixels (x, y) that two objects need to be sharing to be considered overlapping i.e. have collided.

ROBOT_BOARD_BORDER_BUFFER = 2¶

When the robot is added to the board we avoid placing it near the border of the screen. This is the amount of spaces away from the border the robot should be placed.

ROBOT_HEAD_START = 3¶

The amount of time in seconds the robot gets a head start before the monsters attack.

ROBOT_VELOCITY = 2.0¶

The speed of the robot (pixels per refresh.)

WHITE = (255, 255, 255)¶

color

class mysterions.Game(window: Surface)¶

Object for the Game itself, within which all other objects are used.

__init__(window: Surface)¶

Creates a new game and sets the initial values.

play_game() → None¶

Where the Game runs. A continuous loop checks for key events, updates game objects, and refreshes the display.

release_monsters() → None¶

Set by separate thread after a preset time, Monster s can move once set to true.

set_board() → None¶

Creates a representation of the Game board and populates it with objects [Door, Monster, Coin, Robot]

class mysterions.Monster(finex: float, finey: float, image: <module 'pygame.image' from '/home/revwaldo/.local/lib/python3.13/site-packages/pygame/image.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so'>, velocity: float = 1.0)¶

Monster object, including methods for autonomous navigation.

class Straight(this_monster: Monster)¶

Collects the methods and variables for maneuvering around fixed stationary objects (i.e. Door)

__init__(this_monster: Monster)¶
direction - x, y multiplied against velocity to create vector
paces - how far to travel in this direction?
move_count - how far have we gone in this direction?
completed - have we completed going in this direction?
knight_moves_stage - for a knight_moves() maneuver, at what stage are we?
knight_moves(cmd: str = None, best: list[list[int, int], float] = None) → str¶

Called by the move() function, it sets up and manages a set of maneuvers for moving around obstacles. An L-shaped maneuver is taken, first following the clearest path (see best_direction()) for a fraction of the total available distance (currently one-half), followed by a random left or right perpendicular turn for another random distance. If this results in another possible collision, the maneuver is repeated. If the maneuver completes and the way is clear, the maneuver is changed to charge().

random_turn() → list[list[float, float], int]¶

Used as part of the knight_moves() maneuver, creates a new straight path that is perpendicular to the previous one (either turn left or right) for a random number of paces.

straight() → list[float, float]¶

Checks if a Monster currently following a straight path (as part of a larger maneuver) has completed the path, and if not, keep going by returning the change it needs to make to continue.

__init__(finex: float, finey: float, image: <module 'pygame.image' from '/home/revwaldo/.local/lib/python3.13/site-packages/pygame/image.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so'>, velocity: float = 1.0)¶

Inherits position and velocity from Moving parent object. Sets initial maneuver method and creates Straight maneuver object.

best_direction(things: dict[str, list], window: <module 'pygame.rect' from '/home/revwaldo/.local/lib/python3.13/site-packages/pygame/rect.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so'>) → set[list[list[int, int], float], bool]¶

Determines the direction (LRUD) the Monster can travel the greatest distance, and also if the Monster is clear of obstacles (nothing in its way LRUD for a minimum set distance.)

Returns the direction and distance, and boolean value clear.

charge(target: Robot) → list[float, float]¶

Returns the vector (direction * velocity) for the Monster to head toward the Robot. As a limitation, it can only go LRUD until it is a specific distance from the Robot, at which point the direction can be diagonal.

move(target: ~mysterions.Robot, things: dict[str, list], window: <module 'pygame.rect' from '/home/revwaldo/.local/lib/python3.13/site-packages/pygame/rect.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so'>, monsters_are_go: bool) → None¶

Primary function for moving The Monster. Applies a maneuver and determines if it would result in a collision (and revises the strategy accordingly), and checks if the applied maneuver is continuing or completed. Finally applies the vector change to the Monster.

wobble(change: list[float, float], velocity: float, drink_rng: int) → list[float, float]¶

Adds a random additional vector to an existing change to give the aesthetic effect of a wobble to the Monster. (This was originally intended as a way of getting around obstacles.)

class mysterions.Moving(finex: float, finey: float, image: <module 'pygame.image' from '/home/revwaldo/.local/lib/python3.13/site-packages/pygame/image.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so'>, velocity: float = 1.0)¶

The base class for moving objects (Robot, Monster).

__init__(finex: float, finey: float, image: <module 'pygame.image' from '/home/revwaldo/.local/lib/python3.13/site-packages/pygame/image.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so'>, velocity: float = 1.0)¶

Position (finex, finey), velocity, and image

finex, finey, and velocity – floats which allow for fractional velocities for finer movements. Positions are converted to int values and assigned to object’s rect.topleft.

image – the pygame.image graphic

is_collision(things: dict[str, list], change: list[float, float], window: Rect) → bool¶

Determines if object’s planned position change will result in a collision with a stationary object that prevents movement (e.g. a Door) or with the edge of the window.

is_overlap(location: <module 'pygame.rect' from '/home/revwaldo/.local/lib/python3.13/site-packages/pygame/rect.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so'>, item: object) → bool¶
Process similar to pygame.Rect.colliderect(new_location, item)
input: two Rect objects - location of bot, item (Monster, Coin, Door)
check if they overlap by x amount
return True or False
class mysterions.Mysterions¶
__init__()¶

Initializes pygame and the window, initializes the Game, begins the loop of setting the board and playing the game.

class mysterions.Player¶

Object that holds the player’s state. It is separate from the Robot object.

Where the player’s score, round, life, and health are tracked.

__init__()¶
round_sync() → None¶
A simple function, but it needs explaining.
The round_current value is set equal to round at the start of each round.
During play_game() the two values are compared.
As long as the two values are equal, the current game remains active.
When the player collects all the coins or player loses a life (but not all the lives),
a new round can start, and the value of round is incremented by one.
When round_current and round are no longer equal, a new board is set and a new round starts.
This just sets round_current equal to round again.
class mysterions.Robot(finex: float, finey: float, image, velocity: float = 1.0)¶

Robot object, including methods for collisions with Coin s and Monster s.

__init__(finex: float, finey: float, image, velocity: float = 1.0)¶

Position (finex, finey), velocity, and image

finex, finey, and velocity – floats which allow for fractional velocities for finer movements. Positions are converted to int values and assigned to object’s rect.topleft.

image – the pygame.image graphic

found_coin(things: dict[str, list], player: Player) → None¶

Determines if the Robot has collided with a Coin . If so, it removes the Coin from the collection and updates the score. If all the Coin s are collected (win the round), increment the life and round values.

keys(event: <module 'pygame.event' from '/home/revwaldo/.local/lib/python3.13/site-packages/pygame/event.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so'>) → None¶

Captures the LRUD and Quit key events. Called by play_game()

monster_mash(things: dict[str, list], player: Player) → None¶

Determines if the Robot has collided with a Monster . If so, it removes the Monster from the collection and updates the health value. If health goes to zero (lose the round), decrement the life value and increment the round value.

move(things: dict[str, list], window: <module 'pygame.rect' from '/home/revwaldo/.local/lib/python3.13/site-packages/pygame/rect.cpython-313-x86_64-linux-gnu.so'>, player: ~mysterions.Player) → None¶

Translate the values set by the key events to change in location. Determines if the change results in collision. If not, apply the change. Check if new location results in collision with Coin s or Monster s.

to¶

Inherits positing and velocity from Moving parent object. Plus the variables for the LRUD key events.
